security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No code execution, network calls, filesystem access, or external commands. The SKILL.md file was packaged as a ZIP archive but contains only text-based methodology content.

content.value_statement: Complex tasks become overwhelming without structure. This skill breaks down difficult problems into manageable steps with checkpoints, branching logic, and iterative refinement for systematic problem-solving.
actual_capabilities: Decomposes complex problems into numbered steps with clear checkpoints
Supports conditional branching logic based on intermediate results
Records decision rationale and maintains full traceability
Enables iterative refinement with backtracking to earlier steps
Validates each stage before proceeding to the next
limitations: Does not execute code or perform calculations automatically
Requires user to provide domain-specific knowledge
No built-in integration with external tools or APIs
Process documentation only - no automated implementation

use_cases.title: Algorithm Design
use_cases.description: Design complex algorithms with traceable steps, checkpoints, and branching logic for robust implementation

use_cases.title: Architecture Planning
use_cases.description: Plan large system architectures by breaking down modules into manageable components with clear dependencies

use_cases.title: Systematic Debugging
use_cases.description: Systematically trace error sources through staged verification and iterative hypothesis testing

prompt_templates.title: Simple Problem
prompt_templates.prompt: Use sequential thinking to solve [problem]. Define the goal, break it into 3-4 numbered steps, add checkpoints after each step, and verify the final result.

prompt_templates.title: Branching Logic
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply sequential thinking to [complex scenario]. Include IF/ELSE branches for different conditions. For each branch, define the path and how to validate success.

prompt_templates.title: Iterative Refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: Solve [problem] using sequential thinking with iterative refinement. After reaching step 3, review and improve each previous step based on new insights.

prompt_templates.title: Full Methodology
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the complete sequential thinking methodology to [complex task]. Include: problem definition with constraints, step decomposition with checkpoints, branch handling, iterative refinement, and final validation against original goals.

output_examples.input: Design a user authentication system using sequential thinking
output: Goal: Create secure authentication with login, registration, and session management
Step 1: Define requirements - users, passwords, sessions, API endpoints
Step 2: Choose technology stack - framework, database, security libraries
Step 3: Implement registration - validation, password hashing, database storage
â†’ Checkpoint: Verify password storage uses proper hashing (bcrypt/argon2)
Step 4: Implement login - credential verification, session token generation
â†’ Checkpoint: Verify rate limiting prevents brute force attacks
Step 5: Implement session management - token refresh, logout, timeout
â†’ Validation: System meets all original requirements

best_practices: Always define clear goals and constraints before starting step decomposition
Add checkpoints after each step to validate progress before continuing
Document the reasoning behind each decision for future reference
anti_patterns: Skipping checkpoints and proceeding without validation
Combining multiple concerns into a single step
Failing to define exit criteria for the process

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works across all conversation contexts where structured reasoning is needed.

faq.question: How many steps should I use?
faq.answer: Start with 3-5 steps per problem. Complex problems can have more but maintain checkpoint validation between them.

faq.question: Can I combine with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Works well with Software Planning Tool for implementation and Context7 for maintaining step context across sessions.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, network access, or file system access. All processing occurs in your conversation.

faq.question: What if a step fails validation?
faq.answer: Use iterative refinement to backtrack to earlier steps. Modify the approach and re-execute from the failing checkpoint.

faq.question: How is this different from chain of thought?
faq.answer: Sequential thinking adds explicit checkpoints, branching logic, and iterative refinement for more structured and verifiable reasoning.
